all manner of priceless riches and delights in abundance, much more even
than the Happy Isles, and, having no owner or inhabitant, it is superior every-
where in abundance of riches to all those other lands that men inhabit. Now, if
anyone tell me that it is like this, I shall easily understand what is said, since
nothing is difficult about it. But if he should then go on to say, as though it
